title: Green Salads
introduction: Green salads exemplify the elegance of Italian cooking, relying on the freshest of vegetables and the simplest of dressings to highlight natural flavors. Tossed with a hint of high-quality extra-virgin olive oil and a splash of wine vinegar or fresh lemon juice, these salads can serve as a perfect accompaniment to a meal or a standalone dish when enriched with cheese, tuna, chicken, or eggs.
ingredients: Fresh assorted greens (romaine, Boston, leaf lettuce, m√¢che, etc.)
Wine vinegar or fresh lemon juice
instructions: Remove any stems and discard bruised or discolored leaves from the greens.
Wash the greens in a large basin of lukewarm water, allowing any grit to sink to the bottom.
Lift the greens out of the water and drain them, repeating until no grit remains.
Dry the greens thoroughly using a salad spinner.
Tear the greens into bite-size pieces just before assembling the salad.
Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and wine vinegar or lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Toss gently to coat the greens evenly with dressing.

variationInstructions: Add slices of fresh mozzarella or other cheese.
Include a can of drained tuna or cooked chicken strips.
Top with boiled eggs, sliced or quartered.
